L  ong may he live, enjoying health and peace,</br>A  nation's gratitude, with competence,—</br>F  avour'd by heaven, may ev'ry trouble cease,</br>A  nd may he feel all joys of soul and sense;</br>Y  et come it must — ah!  be the day far hence,</br>E  re it be said his mortal sun is set;</br>T  hen this to him, the blessed consequence,</br>T  hat while with tears a nation's eyes are wet,</br>E  nraptur'd angels meet and welcom'd La Fayette.</br>
